poem:
**Sanctions**

Trump's ink fresh on the pen,  
paper thin promises fly west,  
across whispered oceans,  
to tables where men,  
tight-lipped and tie-bound,  
shape words sharp as winter's breath.  
They meet in shadows,  
decisions ready  
to sketch new maps  
on old, familiar lands—  
a stage set for silence  
echoing louder than bombs.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says he is ready to impose new sanctions on Russia. The US president, who has previously stepped back from financial threats to Russia, has this week said he is ready to move to a second stage of sanctions. Their form, if they were". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
